File.Title: What is the economic burden of malaria?
File.HtmlText:
Malaria consumes an important part of the household income in Africa and pushes them further into poverty.

  • Malaria consumes 4-13% of annual family income in Tigray region in Ethiopia (GMAP financing strategy document) and 2.7-3.9% in Tanzania (a).
  • In the Maputo district of Mozambique, one third of households incurred catastrophic payments related to malaria and this rate was 9-12.5% in 2 districts with highest malaria burden in South Africa (b).
  • The estimated national cost of malaria in children <5years expressed in US$ (2009) was 37.8 M in Ghana, 109.04 M in Kenya and 131.94 M in Tanzania. (c)
